result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Suggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Suggs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court for Brandon J Suggs.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2 - Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work, childcare and school. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9  months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 5:00pm today.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Complete a firearms safety course.
- No firearms except for during the firearms safety course.
- Submit a DNA sample by end of day and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
*********
PROBATION MAY BE TERMINATED EARLY IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE AGENT.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs appeared by video.  Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad appeared by video for Brandon J Suggs.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Ahmad requests a plea and sentencing date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court for Brandon J Suggs.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Ahmad requests another status conference so he can review discovery with his client. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Assessment for AFTES in the amount of $500.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08/05/2022 pay $50.00 monthly.  Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Munjed Ahmad as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Ahmad accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 9/1/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant is not eligible for a public defender and requests time to retain counsel.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is eligible for a public defender but counsel has not been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon J Suggs in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon J Suggs
Current: 4780 North 118th Street #4, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 4780 North 118th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/13/2022@1:00pm
